name: UpdateAsanaGoal
description:
Update a specific goal in Asana.

Use this tool to update the details of an existing goal in Asana. Only the specified fields in the request will be changed, while others remain unchanged. It returns the fully updated goal record.

parameters.name: goal_unique_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the goal to be updated.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the goal.

parameters.name: goal_update_fields
parameters.description: JSON object containing the fields to update in the goal. Only specified fields will be changed.

value_schema.description: The updated fields for the goal.

parameters.name: included_goal_properties
parameters.description: List of optional goal properties to include in the response. Provide as an array of strings.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true to format the response with line breaks and indentation for readability. Mainly for debugging as it increases response size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: goal_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the goal.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the goal.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: The updated fields for the goal.

value_schema.description: The updated fields for the goal.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
